headline.main: Books of The Times; Woodpecker's Brain Survives, but Will Humans'?

results.snippet: The Diversity of Life  By Edward O. Wilson  Illustrated. 424 pages. Belknap Press of Harvard University Press. $29.95.     In many respects, Edward O. Wilson's important new book, "The Diversity of Life," is a celebration of the miracle of...
results.lead_paragraph: The Diversity of Life By Edward O. Wilson Illustrated. 424 pages. Belknap Press of Harvard University Press. $29.95. In many respects, Edward O. Wilson's important new book, "The Diversity of Life," is a celebration of the miracle of evolution and the astonishing inventiveness of natural selection. You suspect that he's building a case to show how little we know of the environment's complexity and how recklessly we are spending the abundance of nature's storehouse.

headline.main: U.S. and Russia Plan First Joint Space Crews

results.snippet: American and Russian officials signed a joint agreement today that will put Russian astronauts on an American space shuttle and an American astronaut on the Mir space station in the next three years.   The United States and Soviet Union cooperated...
results.lead_paragraph: American and Russian officials signed a joint agreement today that will put Russian astronauts on an American space shuttle and an American astronaut on the Mir space station in the next three years. The United States and Soviet Union cooperated on the manned Apollo-Soyuz space flight in 1975, in which spacecraft from the two countries docked in orbit. But Russians and Americans have never flown as crew members aboard the other's spacecraft.

results.snippet: ALL MEN A DANCIN'    An array of male dancers that includes Honi Coles, one of the country's most accomplished tap dancers, and Fernando Bujones, principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater and numerous other companies, will participate in...
results.lead_paragraph: ALL MEN A DANCIN' An array of male dancers that includes Honi Coles, one of the country's most accomplished tap dancers, and Fernando Bujones, principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater and numerous other companies, will participate in the Connecticut Ballet Theater's "Celebration of Men in Dance," to be held on Saturday at the new Rich Forum Theater in Stamford.

headline.main: In Big Re-election Fight, Glenn Tests Hero Image

results.snippet: For 16 years, Senator John Glenn, space man and movie hero, was the untouchable icon of Ohio politics. But then came the Keating Five scandal, a souring public mood against Congress and now a blistering political advertising campaign characterizing...
results.lead_paragraph: For 16 years, Senator John Glenn, space man and movie hero, was the untouchable icon of Ohio politics. But then came the Keating Five scandal, a souring public mood against Congress and now a blistering political advertising campaign characterizing him as another Senate hack. As a result, Mr. Glenn is facing the first serious re-election challenge of his career. His Republican opponent, Lieut. Gov. Michael DeWine, is well financed, articulate and aggressive.

headline.main: Transcript of 2d TV Debate Between Bush, Clinton and Perot

results.snippet: Following is a transcript of the Presidential debate in Richmond last night between President Bush, Gov. Bill Clinton and Ross Perot, as transcribed by The New York Times: Fair Trade    Q: Tonight's program is unlike any other Presidential debate...
results.lead_paragraph: Following is a transcript of the Presidential debate in Richmond last night between President Bush, Gov. Bill Clinton and Ross Perot, as transcribed by The New York Times: Fair Trade Q: Tonight's program is unlike any other Presidential debate in history -- we're making history now and it's pretty exciting. An independent polling firm has selected an audience of 209 uncommitted voters from this area. The candidates will be asked questions by these voters on a topic of their choosing -- anything they want to ask about. My job as moderator is to, you know, take care of the questioning, ask questions myself if I think there needs to be continuity and balance, and sometimes I might ask the candidates to respond to what another candidate may have said.

results.snippet: An article yesterday about the United States Senate race in Ohio referred to Senator John Glenn's service as an astronaut incorrectly in some copies. He was in the Mercury space program, not Gemini.
results.lead_paragraph: An article yesterday about the United States Senate race in Ohio referred to Senator John Glenn's service as an astronaut incorrectly in some copies. He was in the Mercury space program, not Gemini.

results.snippet: As the home of the nation's Manned Space Flight Program, the NASA/Johnson Space Center 20 miles south of Houston has long been a powerful magnet for tourists, attracting one million visitors in 1991. But with a $70 million visitor center, set to...
results.lead_paragraph: As the home of the nation's Manned Space Flight Program, the NASA/Johnson Space Center 20 miles south of Houston has long been a powerful magnet for tourists, attracting one million visitors in 1991. But with a $70 million visitor center, set to open this weekend, it seems certain to become more popular. The complex, Space Center Houston, has been in various phases of planning and construction since 1986 by the Manned Space Flight Foundation, a nonprofit group that is independent of the Federal Government. It promises visitors a broad array of exhibits and programs.

headline.main: Astronauts Say 'Arrivederci!' As a Satellite Is Whirled Aloft

results.snippet: The Columbia's six astronauts ejected a mirrored Italian satellite from the space shuttle today, and an attached rocket lofted it into orbit nearly 4,000 miles above Earth.   The 900-pound, prism-studded ball, the Laser Geodynamics Satellite 2, or...
results.lead_paragraph: The Columbia's six astronauts ejected a mirrored Italian satellite from the space shuttle today, and an attached rocket lofted it into orbit nearly 4,000 miles above Earth. The 900-pound, prism-studded ball, the Laser Geodynamics Satellite 2, or Lageos-2, spun like a top as it floated from the cargo bay. It was the main event of the astronauts' 10-day mission, which began Thursday when the Columbia roared aloft from Cape Canaveral, Fla.

headline.main: Profiles of the Crew Aboard the Shuttle

results.snippet: James D. Wetherbee --    Mission Commander     Commander Wetherbee, a 39-year-old Navy pilot, is flying his second shuttle mission in less than three years. He was the pilot of the Columbia when it orbited the Earth for 11 days (a record until...
results.lead_paragraph: James D. Wetherbee -- Mission Commander Commander Wetherbee, a 39-year-old Navy pilot, is flying his second shuttle mission in less than three years. He was the pilot of the Columbia when it orbited the Earth for 11 days (a record until Columbia's 13-day flight in July), and has logged more than 3,500 hours of flight time in civilian and space agency aircraft since being designated a naval aviator in 1976.

headline.main: Games at Highest Level (Measured in Altitude)

results.snippet: SOME day humans will no doubt play bridge in space, but it does not seem to have happened yet.   Col. Gerald P. Carr of Huntsville, Ark., learned bridge in 1955 while in Marine Corps flight training. But when he was commander of Skylab 3 in 1973-74...
results.lead_paragraph: SOME day humans will no doubt play bridge in space, but it does not seem to have happened yet. Col. Gerald P. Carr of Huntsville, Ark., learned bridge in 1955 while in Marine Corps flight training. But when he was commander of Skylab 3 in 1973-74 he missed his chance to be the first space player. A deck of cards was on board, but "we were too busy to use them," he said.

results.snippet: Columbia's astronauts measured ozone in Earth's upper atmosphere and tested a new toilet today as the space shuttle circled the Earth for a fourth day.   Steven Glenwood MacLean, a Canadian astronaunt, was floating on air in more ways than one.
results.lead_paragraph: Columbia's astronauts measured ozone in Earth's upper atmosphere and tested a new toilet today as the space shuttle circled the Earth for a fourth day. Steven Glenwood MacLean, a Canadian astronaunt, was floating on air in more ways than one.

headline.main: Space Station, Promised for '92, Is Still Mostly on Drawing Board

results.snippet: THIS is the year the space station was to begin flying as an orbital outpost for American astronauts, opening a new era of exploration in time for the 500th anniversary of Columbus's arrival in the New World.   NASA laid out the plan in 1984,...
results.lead_paragraph: THIS is the year the space station was to begin flying as an orbital outpost for American astronauts, opening a new era of exploration in time for the 500th anniversary of Columbus's arrival in the New World. NASA laid out the plan in 1984, saying the venture would cost $8 billion and take eight years.
